alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 4:30PM EST until December 17 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR BERKELEY AND CHARLESTON COUNTIES... At 430 PM EST, The Awendaw-McClellanville Fire Department reported several flooded locations along Highway 17 north of Awendaw. Flooding was reported on Randall Road, stranding two people in a flooded car. Additional flooding was ongoing in the village of McClellanville. The band of heavy rainfall the caused the flooding has lifted north of the South Santee River. Additional flooding may occur as water levels rise along small creeks and streams late this afternoon. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Isle Of Palms, Awendaw, Jamestown, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Hampton Plantation State Park, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Price Inlet, Santee Coastal Reserve, Cape Island, Capers Inlet, Buck Hall, Tibwin, Halfway Creek, Shulerville, Newland and Germantown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
